Name: bitnami-openldap
Overview: Docker image to run Bitnami OpenLDAP. Check project site for configuration info

@attributes.Name: HTTP_PORT
@attributes.Description: Container Port: 1389

@attributes.Name: HTTPS_PORT
@attributes.Description: Container Port: 1636

@attributes.Name: LDAP_ADMIN_USERNAME
@attributes.Description: Container Variable: LDAP_ADMIN_USERNAME

@attributes.Name: LDAP_ADMIN_PASSWORD
@attributes.Description: Container Variable: LDAP_ADMIN_PASSWORD

@attributes.Name: LDAP_USERS
@attributes.Description: Comma separated list of LDAP users to create in the default LDAP tree. Default: user01,user02

@attributes.Name: LDAP_PASSWORDS
@attributes.Description: Comma separated list of passwords to use for LDAP users. Default: password1,password2

@attributes.Name: LDAP_ENABLE_TLS
@attributes.Description: Whether to enable TLS for traffic or not. Defaults to no

@attributes.Name: Certs folder path
@attributes.Description: Path to your certificates e.g. if you're using SWAG it would be /mnt/user/appdata/swag/keys

@attributes.Name: LDAP_TLS_CERT_FILE
@attributes.Description: File containing the certificate file for the TSL traffic. No defaults. (container's relative path, e.g. /opt/bitnami/openldap/certs/openldap.crt)

@attributes.Name: LDAP_TLS_KEY_FILE
@attributes.Description: File containing the key for certificate. No defaults. (container's relative path, e.g. /opt/bitnami/openldap/certs/openldap.key)

@attributes.Name: LDAP_TLS_CA_FILE
@attributes.Description: File containing the CA of the certificate. No defaults. (container's relative path, e.g. /opt/bitnami/openldap/certs/openldapCA.crt)

@attributes.Name: LDAP_TLS_DH_PARAMS_FILE
@attributes.Description: File containing the DH parameters. No defaults.

@attributes.Name: LDAP_ROOT
@attributes.Description: LDAP database root node of the LDAP tree. Default: dc=example,dc=org

@attributes.Name: LDAP_USER_DC
@attributes.Description: DC for the users' organizational unit. Default: users

@attributes.Name: LDAP_GROUP
@attributes.Description: Group used to group created users. Default: readers

@attributes.Name: LDAP_CONFIG_ADMIN_ENABLED
@attributes.Description: Whether to create a configuration admin user. Default: no.

@attributes.Name: LDAP_CONFIG_ADMIN_USERNAME
@attributes.Description: LDAP configuration admin user. This is separate from LDAP_ADMIN_USERNAME. Default: admin.

@attributes.Name: LDAP_CONFIG_ADMIN_PASSWORD
@attributes.Description: LDAP configuration admin password. Default: configpassword.

@attributes.Name: LDAP_EXTRA_SCHEMAS
@attributes.Description: Extra schemas to add, among OpenLDAP's distributed schemas. Default: cosine, inetorgperson, nis

@attributes.Name: LDAP_SKIP_DEFAULT_TREE
@attributes.Description: Whether to skip creating the default LDAP tree based on LDAP_USERS, LDAP_PASSWORDS, LDAP_USER_DC and LDAP_GROUP. Default: no

@attributes.Name: LDAP_CUSTOM_LDIF_DIR
@attributes.Description: Location of a directory that contains LDIF files that should be used to bootstrap the database. Only files ending in .ldif will be used. Default LDAP tree based on the LDAP_USERS, LDAP_PASSWORDS, LDAP_USER_DC and LDAP_GROUP will be skipped when LDAP_CUSTOM_LDIF_DIR is used. When using this will override the usage of LDAP_ROOT,LDAP_USERS, LDAP_PASSWORDS, LDAP_USER_DC and LDAP_GROUP.

@attributes.Name: LDAP_CUSTOM_SCHEMA_FILE
@attributes.Description: Location of a custom internal schema file that could not be added as custom ldif file (i.e. containing some structuralObjectClass). Default is /mnt/user/appdata/bitnami-openldap/custom.ldif

@attributes.Name: LDAP_ULIMIT_NOFILES
@attributes.Description: Maximum number of open file descriptors. Default: 1024.

@attributes.Name: LDAP_ALLOW_ANON_BINDING
@attributes.Description: Allow anonymous bindings to the LDAP server. Default: yes

@attributes.Name: Appdata
@attributes.Description: Container Path: /bitnami/openldap/data

@attributes.Name: Log debug
@attributes.Description: Turn on debug info in logs
